metadata.title: CVE-2020-15664 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: By holding a reference to the eval() function from an about:blank window, amalicious webpage could have gained access to the InstallTrigger objectwhich would allow them to prompt the user to install an extension. Combinedwith user confusion, this could result in an unintended or maliciousextension being installed. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 80,Thunderbird < 78.2, Thunderbird < 68.12, Firefox ESR < 68.12, Firefox ESR <78.2, and Firefox for Android < 80.

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
